sentence.text: Identifying the central and peripheral vestibular mechanisms responsible for pathology can somatic diversification of immunoglobulins in management of peptidyl-tyrosine phosphorylation.

The most common vestibular disturbances after peptidyl-tyrosine phosphorylation include benign paroxysmal positional vertigo, vestibulo-ocular reflex impairment, visual motion sensitivity, and balance impairment.
